column4: Hey all, my laptop doesnt boot anymore (ubuntu 10.04) since it had an instant poweroff due to empty battery... i alwas get the following error when trying to start: "status: {DRDY ERR} ... failed command: READ DMA EXT ... end_request: i/O error, dev sda, sector 299777953" and lots of other stuff... my windows 7 on the other partiotions starts and from there i can also access my ext3 filesystem. any idea where this comes from?
boot to liveCD and test your RAM and test your partition health
Ram i dont think since windows on the same machine is workling perfectly... but i'll test the partition... which tool? fschk?
it's still wise to test the RAM as RAM i very sensitive to sudden voltage changes
yes use fsck, look at the man page when you get to the live desktop
i made fsck now, and there where no errors. i could also mount my filesystem from livesystem. Anyway i cant boot..
then reinstall grub2 to the drive and you should be ok
i just did fsck /dev/sda5. or are there any more parameters i should have specified? Why should it be grub? but ill try as soon memtest finished its work...
read the man page, like I said

okay, i ran fsck -n /dev/sda5 in order to check and there was "Error reading block 819532 (attempt to read block from filesystem resulted in short read) while getting niext inote from scan". how do you recommand to go on?
gran the ultimate boot cd and use the manufacturers tool to test the drive
I think the power cut may have dmaged your drive in some way
okay, then i first will try to safe as much data as possible on my external device
wy do you not have a backup?
no, not of all files..
the power outage could have fried the IDE, then where is your data?
i can mount it in rescuesystem...

then you may need to use foremost to attempt to rescue the data from an unmounted partition. you will need a suitably sized partition mounted writable to spit the found data onto.I suggest you review your backup regime
im currently simply using rsync to copy the data from internal harddisk to external usb disk. i hope to get the important data..
cheese maybe

cheese does not support audio at all... im looking for somethink like cinerella for example, but that lacks pulse or jack audio support. since im mixing sound via jack, i need a program able to record audio directly from jack or pulseaudio...
